original: @163a * // gnas brgyad chen po'i rtsa ba bzhugs //
analyzed: @163a * // gnas brgyad chen po'i rtsa ba bzhugs //

original: skad kyi dbyings la bsgyur ba'i lugs yin pas /
analyzed: skad kyi dbyings la bsgyur ba'i lugs yin pas /
translated: This is the system of translation of the Sanskrit terms.

original: lugs re res byas pa gcig la sbyor ba yin gyi /

original: bi bhakta lta bu ming ngo cog gi sgra la sbyor ba ma yin no ;
analyzed: bi bhakta lta bu ming ngo cog gi sgra la sbyor ba ma yin no ;
translated: It is not applied to all terms such as vibhakta.

original: / bsdu ba'i gnas ni brgyad de /
analyzed: / bsdu ba'i gnas ni brgyad de /
translated: There are eight topics of inclusion:

original: 'bru mang po pa'i bsdu ba dang / mdor bsdu ba dang / bye brag bsdu ba dang / yan lag gnyis kyi sgo nas kun sdud pa tsam byed pa'i sbyor ba yin no //
analyzed: 'bru mang po pa'i bsdu ba dang / mdor bsdu ba dang / bye brag bsdu ba dang / yan lag gnyis kyi sgo nas kun sdud pa tsam byed pa'i sbyor ba yin no //
translated: The inclusion of many syllables, the inclusion of the brief, the inclusion of the specific, and the application that merely includes all by means of two branches.

original: gzhi bsdu ba ni gnyis te /
analyzed: gzhi bsdu ba ni gnyis te /
translated: There are two topics of inclusion:

original: rigs bsal ba'i bsdu ba dang / rigs ma bsal ba'i bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: rigs bsal ba'i bsdu ba dang / rigs ma bsal ba'i bsdu ba'o //

original: de dag ni de gnyis kyi sgo nas kun sdud pa tsam byed pa'i sbyor ba yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni de gnyis kyi sgo nas kun sdud pa tsam byed pa'i sbyor ba yin no //

original: gzhi gcig tu bsdu ba'i sbyor ba ni gnyis te /
analyzed: gzhi gcig tu bsdu ba'i sbyor ba ni gnyis te /

original: phyogs gcig tu byed pa'i bsdu ba dang / so so phyogs gcig tu byed pa'i bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: phyogs gcig tu byed pa'i bsdu ba dang / so so phyogs gcig tu byed pa'i bsdu ba'o //
translated: The inclusion that makes one side and the inclusion that makes each side.

original: de dag ni gzhi bsdu ba'i sbyor ba phyogs su byas pa las mtshan nyid gcig tu bsdus pa'i sbyor ba yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni gzhi bsdu ba'i sbyor ba phyogs su byas pa las mtshan nyid gcig tu bsdus pa'i sbyor ba yin no //
translated: These are the applications of the single characteristic that are included in the application of the collection of bases.

original: skyes bu'i bsdu ba @163b ni gsum ste /
analyzed: skyes bu'i bsdu ba @163b ni gsum ste /
translated: The collection of persons is threefold:

original: las 'dzin pa'i bsdu ba dang / ba gnyis pa'i bsdu ba dang / byed pa'i tshig gi bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: las 'dzin pa'i bsdu ba dang / ba gnyis pa'i bsdu ba dang / byed pa'i tshig gi bsdu ba'o //

original: de rnams ni yan lag gtso bor ston pa'i sbyor ba yin no //
analyzed: de rnams ni yan lag gtso bor ston pa'i sbyor ba yin no //
translated: These are the applications that show the primary parts.

original: zlas bsdu ba ni gnyis te /
analyzed: zlas bsdu ba ni gnyis te /

original: mthun pa bsdu ba dang / mi mthun pa bsdu ba'o //

analyzed: de dag ni gcig gi zlas gcig shes pa'i sbyor ba yin no //

original: bsgyur ba'i gnas ni bzhi ste /
analyzed: bsgyur ba'i gnas ni bzhi ste /

translated: And a little of body, earth, etc.ğŸ”½The wise one should express the sound of the elements.

original: mu bzhi las gcig tu drang ba la ni gnyis te /
analyzed: mu bzhi las gcig tu drang ba la ni gnyis te /
translated: Translation: and sentient beings, past and present, and non-human beings.ğŸ”½And a little of body, earth, etc.ğŸ”½The wise one should express the sound of the elements.

original: ngo bo nyid kyi tshig dang / khyad par gyi tshig dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyi tshig dang / khyad par gyi tshig dang ldan pa'o //
translated: It is endowed with words of identity and words of distinction.

original: de la ngo bo nyid la ni ngo bo sgrub pa'i tshul gyis yin pa 'grub pa'o //
analyzed: de la ngo bo nyid la ni ngo bo sgrub pa'i tshul gyis yin pa 'grub pa'o //
translated: In this regard, in the case of identity, it is established by the mode of establishing identity, not by the mode of refuting identity.

original: @164a * // ngo bo dgag pa'i tshul gyis ma yin pa 'grub bo //ğŸ”½tshul gzhan gyi sgo nas ni gnyi ga yin pa 'grub po //
analyzed: @164a * // ngo bo dgag pa'i tshul gyis ma yin pa 'grub bo // tshul gzhan gyi sgo nas ni gnyi ga yin pa 'grub po //
translated: It is established by the mode of refuting identity, not by the mode of establishing identity.ğŸ”½It is established by the mode of both, not by the mode of neither.

original: tshul gzhan gcig gi sgo nas ni gnyi ga ma yin pa 'grub po //
analyzed: tshul gzhan gcig gi sgo nas ni gnyi ga ma yin pa 'grub po //
translated: It is established by the mode of neither, not by the mode of both.

original: khyad par gyi tshig dang ldan pa la ni /
analyzed: khyad par gyi tshig dang ldan pa la ni /
translated: In the case of words of distinction, there are four possibilities:ğŸ”½The basis of distinction, but not the distinction.ğŸ”½The distinction, but not the basis of distinction.

original: khyad par gyi gzhi yin la khyad par ma yin pa dang / khyad par yin la khyad par gyi gzhi ma yin pa dang / gnyi ga yin pa dang / gnyi ga ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: khyad par gyi gzhi yin la khyad par ma yin pa dang / khyad par yin la khyad par gyi gzhi ma yin pa dang / gnyi ga yin pa dang / gnyi ga ma yin pa'o //
translated: Both.ğŸ”½Neither.

original: mu gsum pa la ni khyad par yin la khyad par gyis zhim yin pa med do //
analyzed: mu gsum pa la ni khyad par yin la khyad par gyis zhim yin pa med do //
translated: In the third possibility, there is no distinction that is the distinction.

original: mu gnyis la ni khyad par gyi gzhi yin pa'ang med do //
analyzed: mu gnyis la ni khyad par gyi gzhi yin pa'ang med do //
translated: In the second possibility, there is no basis of distinction.

original: yi ge 'jug pa'i gnas ni brgyad de /
analyzed: yi ge 'jug pa'i gnas ni brgyad de /
translated: There are eight bases for the application of letters.

original: sgra dang / skad dang / ming dang / mtshan ma dang / brda dang / tha snyad dang / tshig dang / don no //
analyzed: sgra dang / skad dang / ming dang / mtshan ma dang / brda dang / tha snyad dang / tshig dang / don no //
translated: sound, language, name, sign, convention, expression, word, and meaning.

original: de la sgra ni shes bas zin pa las byung ba dang / ma zin pa dang / gnyi ga las byung ba la sems can du ston pa dang / mi ston bar phye ba dang / lung du ston pa dang / mi ston pa dag go //
analyzed: de la sgra ni shes bas zin pa las byung ba dang / ma zin pa dang / gnyi ga las byung ba la sems can du ston pa dang / mi ston bar phye ba dang / lung du ston pa dang / mi ston pa dag go //
translated: Sound is that which is articulated by consciousness, that which is not articulated, and that which is both. It is divided into that which indicates sentient beings and that which does not, and that which is interpretable and that which is not.

original: skad ni bzhi ste /
analyzed: skad ni bzhi ste /
translated: Language is of four kinds:

original: rang bzhin dang / 'dus byas dang / zur bcag pa dang / sha za'i 'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin dang / 'dus byas dang / zur bcag pa dang / sha za'i 'o //
translated: natural, conventional, onomatopoeic, and demonic.

original: ming ni chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid kyi tshig bla dags te yi ge 'dus pa'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: ming ni chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid kyi tshig bla dags te yi ge 'dus pa'i bdag nyid do //
translated: Name is the designation of the intrinsic nature of things, consisting of a combination of letters.

original: mtshan ma ni 'dis mtshon par byed pas mtshan ma ste snang bar nus pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma ni 'dis mtshon par byed pas mtshan ma ste snang bar nus pa'o //
translated: Sign is that by which something is indicated, and is capable of appearing.

original: brda ni ming dang ming can 'brel par byed pa ste sgra dang don gyi spyi'i rnam pa gzhan la smra bar byed pa'i dus can gyi bdag nyid do //
analyzed: brda ni ming dang ming can 'brel par byed pa ste sgra dang don gyi spyi'i rnam pa gzhan la smra bar byed pa'i dus can gyi bdag nyid do //
translated: Convention is that which connects names with their bearers, and is the means of communicating the general aspect of a word and its meaning to others.

original: tha snyad ni dngos po med pa la dngos por brtags pa ste /
analyzed: tha snyad ni dngos po med pa la dngos por brtags pa ste /
translated: Conventional expressions are the imputation of entities to non-entities.

original: de yang brtags pa dang 'jug pa dang brjod par bcas pa thams cad do //
analyzed: de yang brtags pa dang 'jug pa dang brjod par bcas pa thams cad do //
translated: They are all the imputations, the engagements, and the expressions.

original: de la brda ni go bar byed pa'i bdag nyid yin la /
analyzed: de la brda ni go bar byed pa'i bdag nyid yin la /
translated: Among them, a sign is the nature of the cause of understanding.

original: tha snyad ni 'jug par byed pa'i bdag nyid can yin no //
analyzed: tha snyad ni 'jug par byed pa'i bdag nyid can yin no //
translated: A conventional expression is the nature of the cause of engagement.

original: tshig ni chos rnams kyi khyad par gyi tshig bla dags yin te ming 'dus pa'i bdag nyid can no //
analyzed: tshig ni chos rnams kyi khyad par gyi tshig bla dags yin te ming 'dus pa'i bdag nyid can no //
translated: A word is the name of the distinguishing feature of phenomena, and it has the nature of a collection of letters.

original: don ni chos rang gi ngo bo ji ltar gnas pa'o //
analyzed: don ni chos rang gi ngo bo ji ltar gnas pa'o //
translated: An object is the nature of a phenomenon just as it is.

original: de rnams la yi ge ji ltar 'jug ce na /
analyzed: de rnams la yi ge ji ltar 'jug ce na /
translated: How do letters engage with them?

original: don gyi dngos gzhi las don gyi spyi'i rnam pa skye'o //
analyzed: don gyi dngos gzhi las don gyi spyi'i rnam pa skye'o //
translated: From the actual object, the form of a general object arises.

original: de las sgra spyi'i rnam pa skye'o //
analyzed: de las sgra spyi'i rnam pa skye'o //
translated: From that, the form of a general sound arises.

original: brda dang tha snyad 'byung ngo //
analyzed: brda dang tha snyad 'byung ngo //
translated: Signs and conventional expressions arise.

original: brda dang tha snyad kyi dus skabs na /
analyzed: brda dang tha snyad kyi dus skabs na /
translated: At the time of signs and conventional expressions,

original: yi ge'i tshogs dang / ming gi tshogs dang / tshig gi tshogs kyi rnam pa yod do //
